qualify.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right
qualify.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Free school lunches are given to children who qualify.
You may qualify for unemployment benefit.
Membership qualifies you for a discount on purchases.
qualify.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to pass an examination or finish a course of study that you need in order to do something
qualify.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: After qualifying, doctors spend at least two years working in hospitals.
I finally qualified as a pilot.
qualify.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to have all the necessary qualities to be considered to be a particular thing
qualify.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: It doesnâ€™t qualify as a date if you bring your children with you.
qualify.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if something qualifies you to do something, you have the necessary skills, knowledge, ability etc to do it
qualify.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Fluency in three languages qualifies her for work in the European Parliament.
The certificate qualifies you to work as a dental assistant.
qualify.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to reach the necessary standard to enter or continue in a competition or sports event
qualify.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: She qualified for a spot on the U.S. Olympic speed skating team.
qualify.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to add to something that has already been said, in order to limit its effect or meaning
qualify.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: Could I just qualify that last statement?
qualify.translation[0].definitions[6].de: if a word or phrase qualifies another word or phrase, it limits or adds to the meaning of it
qualify.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to gain the qualifications needed for a particular profession etc
qualify.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: She recently qualified as a pilot.
qualify.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to have the right to claim something
qualify.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: You may be able to qualify for unemployment benefit.
qualify.translation[1].definitions[2].de: if your knowledge or ability qualifies you to do something, it makes you a suitable person to do it
qualify.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: Our three-week course will qualify you to teach English overseas.
qualify.translation[1].definitions[3].de: to reach a particular stage in the process of competing for the right to do something, for example in a BID (=an occasion when someone offers to buy something, or build or make something)
qualify.translation[1].definitions[3].ex: Three multinational groups have qualified to bid for Emetel, the Ecuadorean telephone company.
